title: Yasuo's Sweeping Blade now COSTS flow rather than granting it
body:
How balanced would he be?

sense isn't the goal of those changes.

Yasuo's damage shouldn't be gated by flow, tryndamere's damage aren't gated, so does all carry's damage (yi, gp's barrel no mana cost, ADC's AA).  and that's why his Q doesn't cost flow

His mobility on the other hand, should be gated, have you laned against yasuo as sion? he dash everywhere, Q'ing,blocking your damage with his shield while you can't do anything and your spell costs mana. same in the middle lane.
His E should be gated, and we should gate it by flow, that will give you the ability to stop his mobility if you damage him.

Now why his Q should gives flow? because else he would be unplayable. The flow already disappear if he takes damage, his windwall costs 100% of flow, he would just be a press Q champ while E/W are only casted 10% of the time.
With his Q giving flow yasuo won't only be a burden of knowledge champion, but also a decision making champion. using his W in the right moment, same for his Q, rebuilding flow with his Q/moving to dash again or rebuild it with his ulti.

that's why those changes are needed
I feel like q and e should be switched, because it make more sense to grant flow from dashing than thrusting.
Nothing about current Yasuo makes sense, especially from a balanced standpoint.
Game mechanics pretty much demand that his primary damage tool not be gated by what would be a VERY limited resource with the suggested changes.

His third q doesn't not give him any extra damage and litterly only limits him to not be able to use it right after he presses his w. litterly stepping 3 units to the left would grant him more than enough flow to use it or even doing his e-q combo. the fact that you think his bull shit non mana resource is limited makes your whole argument seem half assed.

I think these changes would be interesting, but one thing for sure is that his skill floor would raise up a LOT. New people w/ yasuo struggle as it is and it might make it quite a bit harder. Managing the flow definitely seems like its gonna be tough. Utilizing the E+Q is gonna be very important and playing aggressively might come at a cost.

It makes a lot of sense actually. He builds flow by moving and then uses the acquired wind energy for fast dashing around. Also he will have to choose between pure tankiness (shield) and avoidance.  Love the idea.

Wow, I popped Yasuo's shield and instantly all in him since he has 0 flow and can't dash. EZ game, EZ life. Yasuo's flow is not a resource to be managed since he can lose it all instantly by taking a single auto attack. I know the Yasuo hate here is strong but this is ridiculous.
Actually I've been meaning to ask, why the heck does his shield get bigger if it pops after one hit?
What do you mean get bigger? It just activates if he takes damage when his flow is full. That's it. His flow literally does nothing until he has a full bar of it.
At higher levels it requires more flow to reach maximum. But it still pops with one hit.
You generate flow as a % of the total by moving, not at a flat rate. Currently, the rate for charging flow is 1% per 59/52/46 units moved at lvls 1,6,11.
Ok, so this is supposed to make his defense weaker as the game goes on?  Since he'll need more steps to regain his shield the higher level he is?

His shield charges faster the later the game goes on, taking 5900 units moved from levels 1-6 and 4600 from lvl 11 onward. However, the strength of the shield does not scale up at nearly the same rate as the damage champions do, so it does effectively become less useful over time. Early on, Yasuo's shield is really strong and is why his early trading is so dominant if you don't pop the shield first. Later in the game, his shield only serves to make you a little bit harder to burst down after you ult in. An extra 100 health at lvl 1 is worth way, way more than an extra 510 health at lvl 18, for example.

It would need to be tweaked but i think he would be balanced. Will they do this? No never not in a million years, its no secret Riot loves Mobility above all other stats. I don't bash Riot often, in fact I support a lot of their changes, but when it comes to Mobility i can not stand behind them its just too strong compared to immobility.

Roughly the same reason any other mana-using mid laner wants blue. Give her her blue buff properly (if you're a jungler that can afford to do so, that is) and you'll have one of your favorite mid laners.
